{"step_by_step_thinking": "Chemotactic cytokines are a type of cytokine, which are small proteins important in cell signaling. They are also known as chemokines. Their primary function is to stimulate the migration and activation of cells, particularly leukocytes (white blood cells). Among the options given, IL-8 is known to have chemotactic properties, meaning it can induce directed chemotaxis in nearby responsive cells.", "answer_choice": "C"}
